content.rendered:
2023 Masters Golf Travel Packages

Experience golf’s most prestigious tournament at the 2023 Masters. Our luxury travel packages include your preferred Masters Badges (tickets), first-class accommodations near Augusta National, pre-travel personal concierge services, the assistance of our experienced on-site host team and more. For an elevated experience, we can arrange exclusive hospitality options for your choice of rounds. Our bespoke 2023 Masters Travel Packages are available now from $2,475 per person for one practice round and from $4,225 per person for one tournament round, based on double occupancy.

Roadtrips offers custom-crafted Masters packages that provide you with the flexibility to create your perfect golf experience at this legendary tournament. Our Masters specialists will help you design your own itinerary that can include watching the practice rounds, following your favorite golfer through the tournament, or witnessing the green jacket presented to the next winner. Whether you’re traveling for leisure or planning a corporate event, we will tailor a personalized travel package to ensure the golf experience of a lifetime.

About the 2023 Masters Golf Championship at Augusta, Georgia

From April 3-9, 2023, the world’s top golfers will converge upon Augusta National Golf Course — home to the iconic Masters Tournament — for one of professional golf’s four major tournaments. The Masters is a 72-hole, four-day contest, with three practice rounds prior to the tournament rounds. The Masters is steeped in history and tradition and is an event that tops the bucket list of golf fans around the world. In addition to the huge prize purse, the winner also receives a lifetime invitation to the Masters, an invitation to every major tournament in the following five years, and the iconic and highly coveted green jacket.

The annual home of the Masters, Augusta National Golf Club, was founded by golf legend Bobby Jones and businessman Clifford Roberts in 1931. Jones was fascinated by the rolling terrain of the area and used the space to copy holes from his favorite fairways around the world. In 1934 he invited the world’s best golfers to a contest there and the Masters was born.
